intro: Hieracium niveoornatum, commonly known as the white-haired hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and riverbanks. Its scientific name reflects its white-hairy appearance, with "niveoornatum" meaning white-haired in Latin.
